title: Technical issues ground three SriLankan Airlines planes, disrupting flights
byline: Three SriLankan Airlines planes that arrived at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) were found to have technical issues.

title: Police arrest four suspects from Mattakkuliya after TikTok threat involving ’Awa’ gang
byline: Four suspects, including two members of the notorious Jaffna-based ’Awa’ gang were arrested in the Mattakkuliya area in connection with threatening and assault incidents.

title: Revised time announced for Government’s Policy Statement
byline: President Anura Dissanayaka will present the Government Policy Statement at the inaugural session of the 10th Parliament on November 21 at 11.30 am, the Communications Department of Parliament said.

title: Anura Karunathilake appointed as Urban Development minister
byline: No byline

title: Ramalingam Chandrasekaran sworn in as Fisheries Minister
byline: Ramalingam Chandrasekaran was sworn in as the Cabinet Minister of Fisheries, Aquatic and Ocean.

title: Lal Kantha sworn in as Minister of Agriculture and Irrigation
byline: K.D. Lal Kantha was sworn in as the Cabinet of Minister Agriculture, Livestock, Land and Irrigation.

title: Saroja Savithri as Child and Women Affairs minister
byline: Saroja Savithri Polraj was sworn in as the Minister of Child and Women’s Affairs

title: Prof. Chandana Abeyrathna as minister of Public Administration
byline: Prof. Chandana Abeyrathna was sworn in as the Minister of Public Administration, Provincial Councils, and Local Government

title: Harshana Nanayakkara sworn in as Minister of Justice
byline: Harshana Nanayakkara was sworn in as the Cabinet Minister of Justice and National Integration.

title: Vijitha Herath appointed Cabinet Minister for Foreign Affairs, Tourism
byline: Vijitha Herath was sworn in as the Cabinet Minister of Foreign Affairs, Tourism and Foreign Employment.

title: Harini Amarasuriya sworn in as Prime Minister
byline: Dr. Harini Amarasuriya was sworn in as the Prime Minister of Sri Lanka by President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: Security tightened at Presidential Secretariat for swearing-in of new Cabinet
byline: Security has been tightened at the Presidential Secretariat in preparation for the swearing-in ceremony of the new Cabinet of Ministers.

title: Kusal Mendis defies injury as Sri Lanka beat New Zealand to clinch ODI series
byline: Kusal Mendis hit a gritty 74 not out as Sri Lanka posted a thrilling three-wicket win against New Zealand to clinch the three-match one-day international series on Sunday.

title: More than 160 freshers in new Parliament
byline: The new Parliament will see 160 fresh MPs who have been elected for the very first time as people have given the green light to only around 37 members who represented House from 2020 to return.

title: Rise in fever cases, viral infections, dengue among children
byline: A rise in fever cases among children have been observed in viral infections and a growing number of dengue cases, Lady Ridgeway Hospital (LRH) consultant pediatrician Dr. Deepal Perera said.

title: Four key players released ahead of final ODI against New Zealand
byline: Sri Lanka Cricket selectors have decided to release Kusal Mendis, Pathum Nissanka, Kamindu Mendis, and Asitha Fernando from the squad ahead of the third and final ODI against New Zealand.

title: Ravi to face disciplinary action over national seat fuss
byline: Members of the UNP will hurriedly meet at 5:00 pm today to discuss possible disciplinary action against senior member Ravi Karunanayake, who has allegedly self-appointed himself to the national list of the New Democratic Front (NDF).

title: Fresh ethnic clashes in India’s Manipur after six bodies found
byline: India’s north-eastern state of Manipur is on high alert after authorities recovered the bodies of six women and children, who reportedly belonged to the majority Meitei community.

title: Ravi Karunanayake to enter Parliament
byline: New Democratic Front (NDF) has nominated Ravi Karunanayake for its national List seat won by the party at the general election 2024.

title: Southern coastal tsunami warning towers at risk of collapse
byline: Residents of the 2004 tsunami affected areas expressed their frustration, noting that while the 2004 tsunami disaster is being commemorated every year, the tsunami towers built in its aftermath to protect the people from a similar tragedy have been neglected.

title: SC suspends releasing Grade 5 Scholarship exam results
byline: The Supreme Court today issued an interim order suspending the release of results of the Grade 5 Scholarship Examination held on September 15.

title: Know your limit of powers, be accountable: President tells Ministers
byline: Claiming that MPs and Ministers have more powers, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said he expects that all Ministers will know the limits of their powers and act with accountability.

title: Fever outbreak at Army training school: 25 hospitalized, hundreds quarantined
byline: Twenty-five recruits have been hospitalized, with one in critical condition, and over 450 soldiers placed under quarantine following a fever outbreak at the Sri Lanka Army Recruit Training School in Vedditalativu.

title: Cannot reveal some reasons for SJB’s defeat: Marikar
byline: It is not possible to reveal some of the reasons for the Samagi Jana Balawegaya’s (SJB) defeat, the party’s MP elect S.M. Marikar said today.

title: Lohan Ratwatte, wife further remanded
byline: Former State Minister Lohan Ratwatte and his wife were further remanded till December 2 and November 22 respectively.

title: Biden allows Ukraine to strike inside Russia with missiles
byline: US President Joe Biden has given the green light for Ukraine to use long-range missiles supplied by the US to strike Russia.

title: Kumara Jayakody appointed as Energy Minister
byline: Kumara Jayakody was sworn in as the Minister of Energy.

title: Dhammika Patabedi gets Environment Ministry
byline: Dr. Dhammika Patabedi was sworn in as the Minister of Environment.

title: Prof. Anil Jayantha sworn in as Minister of Labour
byline: Prof. Anil Jayantha Fernando was sworn in as the Minister of Labour.

title: Prof. Chrishantha Abeysena appointed as Science, Technology minister
byline: Prof. Chrishantha Abeysena was sworn in as the Minister of Science and Technology.

title: Sunil Kumara Gamage as Youth Affairs minister
byline: Sunil Kumara Gamage was sworn in as the Minister of Youth Affairs and Sports.

title: Wasantha Samarasinghe sworn in as Minister of Trade and Commerce
byline: Wasantha Samarasinghe was sworn in as the Minister of Trade, Commerce, Food Security and Co-Oerative Development.

title: Samantha Vidyaratne gets Plantation & Community Infrastructure ministry
byline: Samantha Vidyaratne was sworn in as the Minister of Plantation and Community Infrastructure.

title: Nalinda Jayathissa appointed Minister of Health and Media
byline: Kalutara District NPP MP Nalinda Jayathissa was sworn in as the Cabinet Minister of Health and Media.

title: Hiniduma Sunil Senavi sworn in as Minister of Buddhist Affairs
byline: Prof. Hiniduma Sunil Senavi was sworn in as the Cabinet Minister of Buddhist Affairs, Religious and Cultural Affairs.

title: Bimal Rathnayake appointed as Transport minister
byline: Bimal Rathnayake was sworn in as the Minister of Transport, Highways, Ports, and Civil Aviation.

title: Ananda Wijepala sworn in as Minister of Public Security
byline: Ananda Wijepala, National Organizer of the NPP’s National Intellectual Organization and private secretary to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has been appointed Cabinet Minister of Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs.

title: Upali Pannilage appointed as Rural Development minister
byline: Upali Pannilage was sworn in as the Cabinet Minister of Rural Development, Social Security, and Community Empowerment.

title: Sunil Hadunnetti sworn in as Industries Minister
byline: Sunil Hadunnetti was sworn in as the Cabinet of Minister of Industries and Entrepreneurship Development.

title: Saroja Savithri appointed as Child and Women Affairs minister
byline: Saroja Savithri Paulraj was sworn in as the Minister of Child and Women’s Affairs.

title: Prof. Chandana Abeyrathna gets Public Administration Ministry
byline: Prof. Chandana Abeyrathna was sworn in as the Minister of Public Administration, Provincial Councils, and Local Government

title: Police go tough on bogus beggars in Anuradhapura sacred sites, arrest six women
byline: Police in Anuradhapura will take strong punitive measures against bogus individuals who would beg money from pilgrims of sacred sites under various pretexts of medical emergencies etc, and placed six such women under custody.

title: Wimal Weerawansa accuses Canadian Tamil Congress of racist, separatist demands
byline: National Freedom Front (NFF) leader and former Parliamentarian Wimal Weerawansa today claimed that organizations like the Canadian Tamil Congress (CTC) have come forward to demand racist, religious and separatist demands.

title: Ravi among three National List MPs gazetted by EC
byline: The Election Commission has gazetted the name of former Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake to one of the two National List seats that were allotted to the New Democratic Front (NDF) following the Parliamentary Elections last week.

title: Third term school holiday starts on Friday
byline: The Education Ministry has decided to grant the first holiday of the first phase of the third school term on Friday, November 22.
